channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oracle founder Larry Ellison has pledged to give away 95% of his $393B fortune—but sudden leadership changes fuel a mystery
item.description: Ellison has a history of changing his plans for distributing wealth.

item.title: Gen Z is deep in ‘financial nihilism’: Why young people are betting big on stocks and crypto
item.description: It’s no secret that Gen Z has a less optimistic economic outlook than older generations. So, it’s no wonder many of them are engaging in so-called “fi...

item.title: The Most Overlooked Infrastructure Fix Is Right Under Our Feet
item.description: Why Connecticut understands how rehabilitating brownfield sites will raise property values and land use.

item.title: Why the AI for Sales Hype May Be Overblown
item.description: Companies rushing to adopt AI tools to boost sales and revenues may not see financial benefits until the technology evolves.

item.title: Jerome Powell says Gen Z without tech skills are getting crushed in the ’low-hire, low-fire’ job market—and colleges are failing them
item.description: While a major economic issue, there’s not much the Fed can do about that, he said.

item.title: New RTO Rules Sound Strict, but Employees Aren’t Blinking

item.title: Robot umpires approved for MLB challenges in 2026
item.description: Robot umpires are getting called up to the big leagues next season. Major League Baseball’s 11-man competition committee on Tuesday approved use of th...

item.title: Build-A-Bear shares continue to soar even with tariffs and struggling mall traffic
item.description: Tariffs and years of teetering mall traffic have roiled much of the toy industry . But Build-A-Bear investors are continuing to reap sizeable gains. S...

item.title: Ford’s CEO: America is ignoring the ‘essential economy’ as AI eats entry-level white-collar jobs
item.description: "There’s more than one way to the American Dream," Ford CEO Jim Farley says.

item.title: AI tools aren’t making much of a difference for companies
item.description: These days, investors, founders, analysts, and tech loyalists can’t stop talking up how artificial intelligence will radically remake the future of wo...

item.title: Here’s Who Trump’s H-1B Visa Fee Will Hurt More Than Startups
item.description: On Friday, the administration announced a $100,000 fee for foreign workers on the specialty visa. It could actually help tech companies and startups.

item.title: One big winner of Trump’s H1-B crackdown could be Canada
item.description: Every time new H1-B restrictions appear, jobs go to Canada.

item.title: Stanford scientists warn that AI ‘workslop’ is a stealthy threat to productivity—and a giant time suck

item.title: Are Your Company’s AI Chatbots Receiving Confidential Business Info?
item.description: Using AI tools can be helpful at work, until your company’s private financial data leaks onto the internet.

item.title: Why brands are playing a bizarre game of matchmaking
